key_channel_insights.line_content: 96.6% of itineraries are marked-up on OTAs, yet the average premium is only 0.11%, implying perception risk outweighs revenue loss.
Metasearch is still cheaper 45% of the time, but this share fell 15 ppt MoM and flips to a 14% premium for >30-day bookings.
GDS lists BT fares in 99% of cases and is higher-priced 98.8% of the time, though with a token 0.10% markup.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 96.6% of monitored OTA fares exceed BT.com, with no cases of parity or under-cutting.
Average OTA premium is just 0.11%, limiting direct revenue impact.
For >30-day bookings the premium widens to 0.17% and incidence is 100%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 96.6% share last week, flat WoW, +0.04 ppt vs month; 0.11 pp premium.
3.4% of ODs not surfaced on OTAs; parity and under-cutting remain at 0%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Same 96.6% higher share and 0.11 pp premium as overall view.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: LV itineraries show 95.5% OTA-higher with 0.09% premium; availability gaps widened WoW.
97.7% higher with 0.12% premium and improved availability.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE cheaper on 45% of OD pairs, down 15 ppt MoM.
For advance sales, 54% price higher on MSE with a 14% premium.
LV origins still discounted 53% of the time, but advantage fell 19 ppt MoM.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No ‘offer not found’ instances across periods.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Cheaper 53% (-19 ppt) with 2% saving; higher 21% cases doubled.
Lower & higher each 37%; higher cases carry 16% premium vs 4% saving when lower.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Higher 54% (+23 ppt) with 14% premium; only 21% cheaper.

gds_highlights.line_content: Average premium just 0.10%, indicating tight control.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 98.8% higher last week, +0.1 ppt MoM; 0.10% premium.
N/A share down to 1.2% (-1.2 ppt MoM).
